info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:07PM EDT until August 22 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee, Dale and Henry and southwest Georgia, including the following county, Clay.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT /645 PM CDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 PM EDT /407 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elba, Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Ozark, Fort Rucker, Ariton, Lee, Arguta, Beamon, Skipperville, Dykes Crossroads, Phillips Crossroads, Roberts Crossroads, Dill, Dale County Lake, Mabson, Ward Bridge, Marley Hill, Dillard and Barefield Crossroads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT /645 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Coffee, AL; Dale, AL; Henry, AL; Clay, GA
